bug.author: aschernov
bug.summary: CVAT new UI: Cancel or tune image shaking while drawing a polygon
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>My actions before raising this issue</denchmark-h>
Read/searched the docs Searched past issues
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected Behaviour</denchmark-h>
An image mustn't shake while drawing any shapes. <denchmark-h:h3>Current Behaviour</denchmark-h>
The left mouse button uses to draw any object and to move an image. It leads to image shaking when we draw some objects, especially polygons. <denchmark-h:h3>Possible Solution</denchmark-h>
Create another mode to move an image while drawing an object. For example, it can be the mouse wheel or Ctrl+LMB <denchmark-h:h3>Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)</denchmark-h>
Just try to draw any polygon quickly enough
<denchmark-h:h3>Context</denchmark-h>
It's very uncomfortable for the concentration and for the precisely annotation. Difficult to annotate objects' boundaries.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/TOsmanov>@TOsmanov</denchmark-link> , please confirm that the problem was resolved.
